column4: Problem:  Neither XP or Ubuntu are detecting my wireless card, the wireless radio switch shows a red light for off, the switch does not respond to, well switching.
Problem:  Neither XP or Ubuntu are detecting my wireless card, the wireless radio switch shows a red light for off, the switch does not respond to, well switching.
best quess is that you need to go into bios and enable it
the bios for my HP laptop is INCREDIBLY limited,  I notice the words "Bios Bug" flash when I load the live session.
what dmesg says about your wireless
in terminal type dmesg .. or dmesg | grep <something>
dmesg?
dmesg shows kernel messages
so it should be able see if kernel did report somereason why wireless isnt working or if it dosent even notice that there is wireless
is there a way to search through the terminal for specific terms/phrases?
dmesg | grep net
means dmesg output is forwarded to grep which search line which matches ti its input in example "net"
WOW....
in linux, there is allways some way to do stuff in terminal effeciently
help me interpret what im seeing here
give me link into pastebin
http://paste.ubuntu.com/11826/
you did get it wrong... grep net was exxample, do like grep wireless or grep somethign you try yo look
and paste whole dmesg into there
